body.name: CYBEX Eezy S Twist +2 V2 Baby Stroller with 360° Rotating Seat for Infants 6 Months and Up - Compatible with CYBEX Car Seats
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22. Order within 19 hrs 55 mins
features: THE STROLLER WITH 360 DEGREE VIEWS: Designed to keep up with moms and dads on the go, this travel stroller offers a smooth ride and no need to move the seat on or off—just use one hand to turn the 360° swivel seat to forward-facing or parent-facing mode
SUN CANOPY WITH UPF 50+ PROTECTION: The CYBEX Eezy S Twist +2 V2 comes with an extra large, expandable sun canopy with a zippered section and UPF 50+ rating to shield your child from the sun
COMPATIBLE WITH CYBEX CAR SEATS: Attach any CYBEX infant car seat (sold separately) to the frame to create a convenient stroller and car seat combo system using included adapters

ALL TERRAIN WHEELS FOR A SMOOTH RIDE: This lightweight and travel-friendly baby and toddler stroller features all terrain wheels for a smooth ride on a variety of surfaces, and folds in seconds, which makes it ideal for trips to the park, family vacations, and other activities where you need a stroller that is easy to transport

DESIGNED FOR MODERN PARENTS: CYBEX is a world leader in child safety and makes car seats, baby carriers, kids furniture and strollers that are not only safe but perfectly suited for today's urban lifestyles
body.description: As a compact stroller with a swivel seat, the CYBEX Eezy S Twist+2 makes life easier for parents and more comfortable for their children. With one hand, you can swivel your child’s seat 360°, from parent-facing to forward-facing in seconds. Ideal for the city lifestyle, the Eezy S Twist+2 folds into a compact, self-standing position, so you can easily stow and go. Made with machine washable fabrics, this stroller also includes a zipped back pocket to access your essentials as well as car seat adapters, a cup holder, rain cover, and bumper bar. CYBEX is the world leader in child safety and makes award-winning car seats, baby carriers, kids furniture and strollers that are not only safe but perfectly suited for today's urban lifestyles.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It’s light and comfortable

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: If you are living sunny place this is perfect. If you are living cold place you should think twice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Es liviano, fácil de abrir y cerrar. El que se gire 360 es un plus aunque la realidad siempre lo tengo hacia el mismo lado. Me gusta mucho.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Issue with adapter
reviews.reviewText: I recently acquired the Cybex baby stroller, model EezyS Twist + 2. I'm satisfied with my purchase and the features it offers to make outings with my child more practical and comfortable.However, I'd like to express a concern. I'm using the original adapter that came with the stroller to attach the Cloud Z2 car seat from the same brand. Nevertheless, I've noticed that the safety lock on the adapter seems to easily come undone and does so frequently.A worrisome situation occurred recently when I was attempting to secure the Cloud Z2 car seat with my child inside. The adapter completely detached, which left me quite frightened and concerned about the product's safety.I have reached out to Cybex's support team three times, but I have not received any response thus far. I'm sharing this experience to ensure that this safety issue is properly addressed and that others are also aware of this potential concern.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars No la recomiendo
reviews.reviewText: Ame como se veía, la ventaja de poder virar RF or FF pero no es estable. Me hubiera gustado que tuviera mejor soporte, la devolví porque mi bebé de 10 meses con solo 22 libras para el lado que se recostara la stroller se inclinaba a ese lado y siento que la estabilidad no era buena y se me puede virar mi bebé o pasar un accidente.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Decent travel stroller if you need a bucket seat, otherwise it’s not really worth it
reviews.reviewText: I bought this after lots of researching. See, I have a baby that demands the following:1) Reversible / parent facing seat2) Really upright seat (like 90 degrees upright)3) One hand recline. He’s a large baby (98 percentile) so most of the strap-based incline systems are too hard to use with him4) Adjustable footrest (seriously he likes to be 90 degrees upright but with knees bent…and this kid is only 8 months old🤦‍♀️)5) Light weight stroller (ok this is more for me)6) Good suspension / wheels (we live in a place that’s near a lot of cobblestones)It’s really hard to find a mix of all of these in a single package, and in the end we were down to this, the Mios and the Nuna Triv Next.The Mios unfortunately was heavier, while the Triv Next was fairly wide and a bit bulky. We were sold on the Cybex for the easy-to-reverse seat option—it’s been great for mall trips where baby changes his mind on what he wants to see. But bare in mind he doesn’t have object permanence yet, so probably it’ll be less of a benefit to toddlers that don’t care about the reversible seat part.The cons of this stroller are:- It’s really narrow. Like I don’t know how much longer baby can fit it’s so narrow. On the plus side it goes through doors really well.- The seat is shallow- Unlike the European version the US/CA version only has 2 recline modes: really upright and almost flat. It’s good enough for us because this baby hates lounging at an angle and wants to be either 90 degrees or 180 degrees…but I know most other kids prefer somewhere in between.- It’s fairly rickety because it’s trying to be a travel stroller, but at the same time it’s not THAT light (at 18 lbs it’s the same as my BabyJogger City Mini, which cost only like 40% of the price and is far sturdier).- The canopy has no peekaboo and is not really deep (though it’s pretty middle of pack for a travel strollers)- Small basket (again this is more of a travel stroller thing)If you don’t care about the reversible seat and want a travel stroller with good wheels I would probably go for the Uppababy Minu. If you care about the reversible seat and ok with the larger size the Nuna Triv would be better. If you don’t care about reversible seat or upright seat for the same price just get the Babyzen YoYo.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Cybex Ez twist stroller
reviews.reviewText: I love that this stroller is light but my son is 13 months and he’s always leaning to the side to want to touch the ground. The stroller tilts to the side with him. It’s not sturdy enough. If u turn to fast the stroller is gonna fall to the side. I’m so mad I have to purchase a sturdy stroller now. I didn’t know this would happen when he was born.
